etymology.description: 花(flower) + 生(to be born; grow) = “born from a flower” → peanut.
etymology.interpretation: Named for the plant’s habit: flowers form above ground and the pods develop after, hence being “born from flowers.” Evokes growth originating from the blossom.

parts.english: flower; blossom; to spend (money/time); to bloom
to give birth; life; raw; to grow

examples.chinese: 我对花生过敏(我對花生過敏)。
这道花生酱拌面很香(這道花生醬拌麵很香)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè dào huāshēngjiàng bànmiàn hěn xiāng.
examples.english: These peanut-sauce noodles are very fragrant.

examples.chinese: 农民在田里种花生(農民在田裡種花生)，秋天收成很多(秋天收成很多)。
examples.pinyin: Nóngmín zài tián lǐ zhòng huāshēng, qiūtiān shōuchéng hěn duō.
examples.english: Farmers plant peanuts in the fields, and the autumn harvest is abundant.
